 21  from abc import ABCMeta, abstractmethod 
 22  from imusim.trajectories.rigid_body import SampledBodyModel 
 23  from imusim.maths.quaternions import Quaternion 
 24  from imusim.platforms.radios import RadioPacket 

 25   
 26 -class PostureReconstructor(object): 

 27      """ 
 28      Base class for posture reconstruction algorithms. 
 29   
 30      A posture estimator takes data from IMUs on a jointed rigid body and 
 31      updates the joint rotations of a L{SampledBodyModel}. 
 32      """ 
 33      __metaclass__ = ABCMeta 
 34   

 35 -    def __init__(self, bodyModel, initialJointRotations=[]): 

 36          """ 
 37          Initialise posture reconstructor. 
 38   
 39          @param bodyModel: The L{SampledBodyModel} to update. 
 40          @param initialJointRotations: List of initial joint rotations 
 41              in depth first pre-order, as L{Quaternion} objects. 
 42          """ 
 43          self._bodyModel = bodyModel 
 44          for joint, rotation in zip(bodyModel.joints, initialJointRotations): 
 45              joint.rotationKeyFrames.add(0, rotation) 
 46   
 47          self._lastCallTime = None 

 48   

 49 -    def __call__(self, data, t): 

 50          """ 
 51          Update the posture of the model given the current model state 
 52          and additional data. 
 53   
 54          @param data: Data friom sensors attached to the body model, as a list 
 55              of L{dict} objects. E.g. these may be L{RadioPacket} objects with 
 56              data transmitted by each IMU. 
 57          @param t: The time at which this data was valid. 
 58          """ 
 59          dt = t - self._lastCallTime if self._lastCallTime is not None else None 
 60          data = dict((d['jointName'], d) for d in data) 
 61          for joint in self._bodyModel.joints: 
 62              self._update(joint, data.get(joint.name, None), dt, t) 

 63   
 64      @abstractmethod 

 65 -    def _update(self, joint, data, dt, t): 

 66          """ 
 67          Internal method to be implemented by subclasses. 
 68   
 69          Update the rotation of a joint given data from a sensor attached 
 70          to that joint. 
 71   
 72          @param joint: 
 73          @param data: Data from sensors attached to the body model, as a 
 74              L{dict} object. E.g. this may be a L{RadioPacket} with data 
 75              transmitted by an IMU. 
 76          @param dt: The time at which to compute the update (float). 
 77          @param dt: Time elapsed since the last update, or None on first update. 
 78          """ 
 79          pass

 81 -class SimpleForwardKinematics(PostureReconstructor): 

 82      """ 
 83      Posture reconstructor using joint orientations directly. 
 84      """ 
 85   

 86 -    def __init__(self, bodyModel): 

 87          PostureReconstructor.__init__(self, bodyModel) 

 88   

 89 -    def _update(self, joint, data, dt, t): 

 90          if data is not None and data.has_key('rotation'): 
 91              joint.rotationKeyFrames.add(t, data['rotation'])

 93   
 94 -class InheritedForwardKinematics(PostureReconstructor): 

 95      """ 
 96      Posture reconstructor using joint orientations with inheritance fallback. 
 97   
 98      Posture reconstruction is performed by applying joint orientations directly 
 99      to the body model, as in SimpleForwardKinematics, however if no data is 
100      available for a joint it inherits the orientation of its parent joint. 
101      """ 
102   

103 -    def __init__(self, bodyModel): 

104          PostureReconstructor.__init__(self, bodyModel) 

105   

106 -    def _update(self, joint, data, dt, t): 

107          if data is not None and data.has_key('rotation'): 
108              joint.rotationKeyFrames.add(t, data['rotation']) 
109          elif joint.hasParent: 
110              joint.rotationKeyFrames.add(t, joint.parent.rotation(t))
